page.title: 11SURVEYS
page.content: {WORK SURVEY A survey was done of the work done by mothers and fathers of children in Classes 1 and 2 at Beaupre Community Primary School, Outwell. Sixty children took part in the survey, aged 8-11 years. The survey took place on June 4th 1985. Each child was allowed two votes, one for their mother and one for their father. It was discovered that 33 fathers work exclusively outside the village whilst 12 work in the village itself. 19 mothers were in paid employment in the village whilst 30 mothers were classified as 'housewives'. 14 mothers and fathers were in paid employment both in and out of the village. It was also found that many mothers and fathers did seasonal work such as strawberry picking and carrot topping on a casual basis.
